description.text: The autocomplete is a normal input field enhanced by a panel of suggested options.

Buttons make common actions more obvious and help users more easily perform
them. Buttons use labels and sometimes icons to communicate the action that will
occur when the user touches them.
Buttons make common actions more obvious and help users more easily perform them. Buttons use labels and sometimes icons to communicate the action that will occur when the user touches them.

The checkbox component is used when the user needs to select one or more
items on a task. This component can also allow the user to turn an option on
or off.

The checkbox component is used when the user needs to select one or more
items on a task. This component can also allow the user to turn an option on
or off.
Switches allow users to turn an individual option on or off. They are usually used to activate or deactivate a specific setting.
Gympass Dropdown is a multiple choice type of menu.
Gympass Dropdown is a multiple choice type of menu.

Lists are a continuous group of text or images. They are composed of items
containing primary and supplemental actions, which are represented by icons and
text.

Lists are a continuous group of text or images. They are composed of items
containing primary and supplemental actions, which are represented by icons and
text.

The Progress Bar is a component used to indicate a progress of an indicator
of quantity.  The use of labels numeric or alphabetic can increase the user
understanding.

The Progress is a component used to indicate a progress of an indicator
of quantity. The use of labels numeric or alphabetic can increase the user
understanding.
Use the Rating component to view other people's opinions and experiences.
Use the Rating component to view other people's opinions and experiences.

Sliders allow users to make selections from a range of values. Sliders
reflect a range of values along a bar, from which users may select a single
value. They are ideal for adjusting settings such as volume, brightness, or
applying image filters.

Sliders allow users to make selections from a range of values. Sliders
reflect a range of values along a bar, from which users may select a single
value. They are ideal for adjusting settings such as volume, brightness, or
applying image filters.

Stepper is responsible for the logic that drives a stepped workflow, it
provides a wizard-like workflow by dividing content into logical steps.

Stepper is responsible for the logic that drives a stepped workflow, it
provides a wizard-like workflow by dividing content into logical steps.
Use Tag component when you want to categorize your content
Use Tag component when you want to categorize your content

Text Area is a type of text field which has a larger initiation size to
encourage a bigger user input. This component has a fixed height and the text
lines are increased when the input reaches the limit of lines established for
the field. This action creates a vertical scroll inside the component.

lines are increased when the input reaches the limit of lines established for
the field. This action creates a vertical scroll inside the component.
This component provides a theme to all React components underneath itself via the context API.

Radio group allows user to select one option from a set of options. Use
value on group to set the selected option.

The Radio is a type of selection control that allows the user to select a
single option from a list.
